label: 月輪観
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Gachirin gan (J.) 月輪観, also pronounced gachirin kan, gatsurin kan, and referred to variously as 阿字観, 字輪観, 浄菩提心観 aji kan, jirin gan, jōbodaishin gan. Meditation on a figure of the moon which encloses the Sankrit character A" in order to realize that the mind of enlightenment is completely pure like the the wheel of the moon, overcoming all dualstic views and culminating in buddha very body. The famous Kōyasan monk and founder of 根来寺 Negoroji 覚鑁 Kakuban (1095-1143) was the most famous proponent of this meditation."
